meanings.definition: Suffering a deterioration after a period of improvement.
meanings.sent1: The relapsing patient showed signs of getting worse again.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained that relapsing meant the illness was coming back.
meanings.sent3: The relapsing puppy kept running in circles, forgetting its training.
meanings.sent4: Her relapsing grades were like a rollercoaster, up and down unpredictably.
meanings.sent5: The relapsing flowers wilted just when they seemed to bloom.

meanings.definition: Falling back into a former state or condition.
meanings.sent1: The relapsing city struggled to maintain its once vibrant atmosphere.
meanings.sent2: After quitting smoking, he found himself relapsing into old habits.
meanings.sent3: The relapsing clock kept going back in time, confusing everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her relapsing memory was like a broken record, repeating the past.
meanings.sent5: The relapsing river returned to its original course, erasing all progress.
